content:
Hey all, wasn't able to make it to the meeting today, but as I think most of the outstanding PRs are merged, I assume it was wrapped up quickly.

One thing that I think is worth discussing is how/if we should break up the tutorials to have the adder be distinct from the calculator/advanced stuff. Right now (mostly for Rust) we kind of jam the super simple adder example and the more complex stuff into the same tutorial, and it might be worth breaking those out.

I figure this might be an easier discussion to have (and remember) async:

@Ivan Towlson @Kate Goldenring @Daniel Macovei @Tim Chevalier @Mikhail Katychev @Eric Gregory thoughts?

Thanks for the setup, @Victor Adossi
I figured this is a good place to discuss https://github.com/bytecodealliance/component-docs/pull/310#issuecomment-3339006563 this comment.

My feelings is the the PR is that the PR is an overall improvement over the present state and it would be better to merge it as-is or close to as-is and handle the breaking up. If anyone has any counter thoughts, feel free to chime in.

refactor(lang/rust): rust language guide by vados-cosmonic 路 Pull Request #310 路 bytecodealliance/component-docs
This commit heavily refactors the rust language guide, accomplishing a few goals: Moving from cargo component to native rust toolchain Removing sections with advanced funtionality We're proba...

Yeah like I noted, definitely agreed, and now that we have a reasonable direction set for the break-out of sections we should be good to go! I just need to find some hours to do the the thing and re-add the deleted code in a reasonable layout
Hopefully I can find some time this week to get this done
